name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Tennessee research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your Tennessee ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for Tennessee ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for Tennessee research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Tennessee research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Tennessee Research Tips and Strategies
    ☆ AR—Beginning to Research Your Ancestors in Tennessee

  2. Get an overview of Tennessee research in these videos.

    ☆ FS—Tennessee Overview—1:30
    ☆ Beginning Tennessee Research—59:23



  3. This handout from the Tennessee Genealogical Society has tips and resources for finding Tennessee ancestors.

    ☆ FS—Tennessee Record Selection Table

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for Tennessee research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Tennessee Resources
    ☆ AC—Tennessee State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  5. Record Finder: Use the Tennessee Record Selection Table to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Tennessee Record Selection Table

    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

    Case Studies
    1. Follow this research study for Tennessee ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

      ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Tennessee Research, 1880-Present

    2. Follow this case study for Tennessee research.

      ☆ LDS—Finding a Tennessee woman's parents without a birth record

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Tennessee in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Tennessee☆
      FS—Wiki: Tennessee Minorities

    2. Learn more about African American records.

      ☆ AG—Tennessee African American Records

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for Tennessee.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Tennessee in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Tennessee
Additional Records

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Tennessee archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Tennessee archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Tennessee archives and libraries in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Tennessee Archives and Libraries

  2. Learn about resources at the Tennessee State Archives.

    ☆ Tennessee State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research
    ☆ RT—Welcome to the new Tennessee State Library and Archives—11:51


  3. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Tennessee.
  4. Explore Tennessee Dept. of Archives collection.
  5. Explore miscellaneous records in the Tennessee State Library and Archives collection.
  6. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Tennessee genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  7. Search for ☆free online books on Tennessee research on the FamilySearch site.
  8. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find Tennessee ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Tennessee city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Tennessee Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Tennessee city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Tennessee city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Tennessee ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Tennessee city directories records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
QUIKLinks

name: Vital and Census Records
section_name: Learn about Tennessee vital and census records.

hidden.summary:

text:

  2. Explore links for vital records on the Tennessee Public Health site.
  3. Search for online Tennessee ☆vital records and find addresses for state offices to write to for records.
  4. Explore Tennessee birth, marriage, and death records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  5. Explore additional links for Tennessee vital records on the ☆Linkpendium site.

text:

Tennessee Death Records

  2. Search for death records on the Tennessee State Library & Archives site.

  2. Find links to Tennessee newspapers on the Wikipedia site.
  3. Search the Tennessee Online Historical Newspapers site.
  4. Explore Tennessee newspaper resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  5. See additional Tennessee newspaper resources on the Linkpendium site.
  6. Explore additional links for Tennessee newspapers and obituaries on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Tennessee County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Tennessee.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Tennessee Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Tennessee research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the Tennessee Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Tennessee Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Tennessee Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. South Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Tennessee.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Tennessee research.
  2. Explore the Tennessee research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Tennessee research.
  4. Explore Tennessee research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Tennessee in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Tennessee Societies

  2. Explore the Tennessee Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore Tennessee genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  4. Get help at a family history center in Tennessee.
Regional/Local Societies
